Protection chunk macros AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_CHUNK2ADDR: Convert a chunk number to an address AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_CHUNK2INST: Convert a chunk number to an instance number AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_ADDR2CHUNK: Convert an address to a chunk number

◆ AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SIGNATURE0

#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SIGNATURE0   0x48EAAD88

Define the customer info signature data (at AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_ADDR). These bits must exist in the customer info space in order for many of the security and protection functions to work.

◆ CYCLESPERITER

#define CYCLESPERITER   (AM_HAL_CLKGEN_FREQ_MAX_MHZ / 3)

Given an integer number of microseconds, convert to a value representing the number of am_hal_flash_delay() cycles that will provide that amount of delay. This macro is designed to take into account some of the call overhead and latencies.

e.g. To provide a 10us delay: am_hal_flash_delay( FLASH_CYCLES_US(10) );

As of SDK 2.1, burst mode is accounted for in am_hal_flash_delay().

The FLASH_CYCLES_US macro assumes:

  • Burst or normal mode operation.
  • If cache is not enabled, use FLASH_CYCLES_US_NOCACHE() instead.

◆ FLASH_CYCLES_US

#define FLASH_CYCLES_US (   n)    ((n * CYCLESPERITER) + 0)

◆ FLASH_CYCLES_US_NOCACHE

#define FLASH_CYCLES_US_NOCACHE (   n)    ( (n == 0) ? 0 : (n * CYCLESPERITER) - 5)

◆ ISADDRFLASH

#define ISADDRFLASH (   x)    (x <= (AM_HAL_FLASH_LARGEST_VALID_ADDR & ~0x3))

◆ ISADDRSRAM

#define ISADDRSRAM (   x)
Value:
((x >= AM_HAL_FLASH_SRAM_ADDR) && \
(x <= (AM_HAL_FLASH_SRAM_LARGEST_VALID_ADDR & ~0x3)))
AM_HAL_FLASH_SRAM_LARGEST_VALID_ADDR
#define AM_HAL_FLASH_SRAM_LARGEST_VALID_ADDR
Definition: am_hal_flash.h:78
AM_HAL_FLASH_SRAM_ADDR
#define AM_HAL_FLASH_SRAM_ADDR
Some helpful SRAM values and macros.
Definition: am_hal_flash.h:76

Macros to determine whether a given address is a valid internal flash or SRAM address.

Typedef Documentation

◆ g_am_hal_flash_t

typedef struct am_hal_flash_helper_struct g_am_hal_flash_t

Structure of pointers to helper functions invoking flash operations.

The functions we are pointing to here are in the Apollo 3 integrated BOOTROM.
